intro: Campanula glomerata var. semgensis, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
